title: Berkshire live: Tuesday 6 December - BBC News
summary: man dies after taking part in reading toy run .
hennessy sponsorship deal ends at newbury racecourse .
south central ambulance service will carry on running the nhs 111 service .
reading fc to play man u in fa cup .
awe staff staging second 24-hour strike over changes to pension scheme .
arson at indian restaurant in cookham .
reading choir in gareth malone final .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thank you for joining us again today .
we 'll be back tomorrow at 08:00 with all berkshire 's latest news , travel , weather and sport .
stay in touch via our twitter and facebook pages .
author: Toby Wadey
BBC Berkshire Online

documents.title: latest berkshire headlines
text: latest berkshire headlines
author: Toby Wadey
BBC Berkshire Online

documents.title: fa cup third round draw
text: radio berkshire 's sports editor tim dellor has been speaking to the former reading player brynjar gunnarsson about the draw - and his memories of past meetings in the competition .

documents.title: wedding dress exhibition
text: there 's a special exhibition on at west berkshire museum in newbury .
they 're celebrating the changing fashion of wedding dresses and bbc radio berkshire 's sarah walker spoke to dawn sellick to find out more about what visitors can expect .

documents.title: reading-based band the amazons on bbc music sound of 2017 longlist
text: reading band the amazons have made it to the bbc music sound of 2017 longlist .
the list , which has previously featured the likes of sam smith , ellie goulding and adele , shows who 's predicted to go on to achieve big things next year and beyond .
berkshire introducing 's bridgitte tetteh caught up with them to hear their thought on the news , ad to look back on their journey with bbc introducing so far
author: Bridgitte Tetteh
BBC Radio Berkshire reporter

documents.title: bulmershe ensemble through to final of bbc competition
text: a choir from a school in woodley is hitting the high notes after sailing through to the final round of a bbc singing competition .
the bulmershe school ensemble , from the woodlands road school , are taking part in gareth malone 's new series the choir :
gareth 's best in britain on bbc two , and during tuesday night 's episode , they found out they had been selected to represent the south east in the final .

documents.title: prime minister listens to bbc radio berkshire
text: in an interview with the radio times , prime minster theresa may divulged that `` when we 're going to bed at home , i quite like listening to bbc radio berkshire '' .

documents.title: bracknell budget cuts
text: further rises in council tax look to be on the way in bracknell as the borough council reveals plans to plug a £ 10 million gap in its budget next year .
the borough wo n't formally set the council tax rate until next march but says it 's looking to raise it by just under two per cent .
bracknell says it 's already identified where it can save more than £ 5 million next year but still needs to save £ 4.5 million more .
putting up council tax , cutting services and dipping into its reserves are the three main areas it 's looking at .
we have no choice but to identify savings and deliver them as quickly as possible .
i would encourage our residents to look at the draft budget proposals which are on the council 's website and let us have their thoughts on them .
it 's important that we spend our money wisely on things that make the greatest positive contribution to people 's lives .
author: Patrick O'Hagan
BBC Berkshire political reporter

documents.title: could a smartphone replace a doctor ?
text: could this be a revolutionary new way of providing healthcare ?
inhealthcare have make the software , that can measure and monitor long-term conditions for people at risk of heart attacks , blood clots and strokes .
they 're rolling this out in bracknell now as a trial with gps .

documents.title: aldermaston housing development 'will destroy historical parkland '
text: `` devastating '' plans for a housing development on a medieval park should be turned down , conservationists say .
up to 227 new houses are due to be built in aldermaston park , near reading , berkshire , as part of proposals `` to restore its grade ii listed victorian manor and grounds '' .
the woodland trust said the development would damage a historically important wood pasture and parkland .
more than 180 trees would be lost - some a hundred years old , it added .
author: Sarah Lee
South Online

documents.title: motorcyclist dies after crash on m4
text: a 27-year-old motorcyclist from slough has died following a two-vehicle collision on the m4 .
the woman was travelling westbound near the junction for langley at about 22:45 on monday when she was involved in the crash with a grey mercedes c class car .
the victim , who was riding a green kawasaki motorcycle , was taken to hospital but later died in hospital .
her next of kin have been informed .
thames valley police said it was appealing for witnesses .
author: Toby Wadey
BBC Berkshire Online

documents.title: sponsor ends 60-year gold cup deal
text: the sponsor of the hennessy gold cup is pulling out after 60 years of backing the famous race .
the deal between the cognac house and newbury racecourse is said to have been the longest standing commercial sponsorship in sport .
it means that this year 's hennessy gold cup , won by native river , was the last bearing the company 's name .
newbury racecourse said it was `` fitting '' the contract was ending after `` such a thrilling race '' .

documents.title: houses 'will destroy historical park '
text: houses 'will destroy historical park '

documents.title: people leap from curry house blaze
text: people leap from curry house blaze

documents.title: berkshire fire stations at risk of closure
text: the future of pangbourne fire station looks in doubt under plans being drawn up by the royal berkshire fire and rescue service .
it needs to save £ 2.4 million by 2020 to balance the books .
it 's drawn up seven options looking at how it could save £ 1.4 million by reorganising the way it runs berkshire 's fire stations .
five of those options include the idea of closing down the station at pangbourne .
wargrave fire station is also at risk .
the fire service says it 'll start running a public consultation service next week asking people how they think the service can make the savings needed .
the consultation will run until march , so any final decisions on the fire stations at pangbourne and wargrave wo n't be made for months yet .
author: Patrick O'Hagan
BBC Berkshire political reporter

documents.title: travel : power restored at basingstoke train station
text: the power is back on at basingstoke station .
trains are now able to run again but residual delays are expected .
a loss of signalling caused by a power failure means the lines are blocked in both directions between basingstoke and reading at the moment .
power has been restored and trains are able to run through in both directions again .
residual delays are to be expected .
author: Tara Maxwell
BBC Radio Berkshire newsreader

all lines are affected , including gwr , south west trains and cross country services .
a loss of signalling caused by a power failure means the lines are blocked in both directions between basingstoke and reading at the moment .
power has been restored and trains are able to run through in both directions again .
residual delays are to be expected .

documents.title: nhs 111 deal
text: the ambulance service which covers berkshire will carry on running the nhs 111 call service .
it lost the contract to a rival operator in a recent bidding war , but the winner 's now dropped out , leaving the way clear for the south central ambulance service ( scas ) .

south central say that holding on to the 111 telephone service will make it easier for it to transfer people who call a 111 operator to its own ambulance call centre , making it less likely that anything is lost in translation .
author: Patrick O'Hagan
BBC Berkshire political reporter

documents.title: love for reading in the fog ❤️
text: love reading in the fog !

documents.title: tribute to reading man killed in wallingford fatal collision
text: the family of a motorbike rider killed in a crash have paid tribute to a `` doting father '' and `` loving son and brother '' .
michael john dix , 27 , died in a crash on the a4074 near ipsden at about 00:00 gmt on 29 november .
his family said he was `` a man who will be sorely missed by everyone who had the pleasure of knowing him '' .
an 18-year-old wallingford man has been arrested on sus of causing death dangerous driving and drink driving .
author: Joe Nimmo
BBC News

documents.title: seven jump from the windows of a curry house in cookham arson fire
text: a fire in which seven people jumped to safety from a berkshire curry restaurant is being treated as arson .
police and fire crews were called out to the fire in maliks in cookham high street at 01:45 gmt .
police said the people living above the restaurant jump jumped out of windows on both first and second floors to escape the blaze .
one man in his twenties was taken to hospital with leg injuries , and the others were treated at the scene .
the injured man has since been discharged .

documents.title: sponsorship deal ends at newbury racecourse
text: the longest-running sporting sponsorship in the world has come to an end at newbury racecourse .
it announced today that the 60th hennessy gold cup , which was won by native river , was the last running of the historic race under the backing of hennessy .
the first three hennessy gold cups took place at cheltenham , from 1957 to 1959 , with the initial contest won by the legendary mandarin , owned by peggy hennessy , a member of the hennessy family .
from 1960 onwards , the race has taken place every year at newbury and has established itself as one of the most popular events in the steeplechasing programme
it 's not yet known who will take over the sponsorship .
author: Tara Maxwell
BBC Radio Berkshire newsreader

documents.title: man dies after taking part in reading toy run
text: a man has died after taking part in the reading toy run .
paramedics were called to the event at 14:46 gmt on sunday after a rider fell ill at the end of his ride .
south central ambulance service said the man , in his 50s , was taken to the royal berkshire hospital in a critical condition .
toy run organisers said that he died later in hospital .
author: Sarah Lee
South Online

documents.title: reading mp backs bulmershe ensemble in tv competition
text: reading mp backs bulmershe ensemble in tv competition

documents.title: passengers at reading station increase by 400,000 in 2016
text: the office of rail and road has released passenger figures which show the number of people passing through reading station increased by 400,000 in 2016 .
it was the third most heavily used station in the south east , with gatwick airport and brighton station experiencing higher passenger numbers in 2015 - 16 .
the statistics were based on estimates of entries/exits between 1 april to 31 march of each year .

text: share your misty with us on our twitter or facebook .
frankel is overlooking a rather misty @ twitterid parade ring this morning
i was there when her majesty unrevealed him .
a fantastic day at ascot # ascotlikeknowwhereelse

documents.title: bus delayed due to heavy traffic
text: 19b from reading station @ 11:20 currently 20 mins late due to heavy traffic .
we apologise for any inconvenience .

documents.title: breakingfire crews called out to cookham fire
text: berkshire fire and rescue say they were called out to a fire shortly before 2am at malik 's indian restaurant in cookham high street .
fire crews from slough and maidenhead attended the blaze , which was extinguished at around 4am .
firefighters had to use breathing apparatus to tackle the fire .
the cause is under investigation .
author: Emma Midgley
BBC News

documents.title: new children 's services proposed for reading
text: a reorganised children 's centre service operating from four hubs in areas of highest need are being proposed for reading under new plans .
the remodelled service will focus on supporting children under 5 and offer specific support for vulnerable families .
there would also be a network of satellite buildings and community venues which would accommodate staff and deliver services .
the proposals will be considered by members of the adult , children 's and education ( ace ) committee on 13 december form part of the council 's requirement to save £ 42m .
author: Sarah Lee
South Online

# batesmotel

documents.title: atomic weapons establishment strike : 24-hour walk-out begins
text: a 24-hour strike is under way at a weapons factory which maintains trident , britain 's nuclear deterrent .
staff at berkshire 's atomic weapons establishment ( awe ) are taking the industrial action over pension changes .
the prospect union said awe workers felt `` deeply betrayed '' , as the government promised pensions would be protected after transferring to the private sector in the 1990s .
awe said `` detailed contingency plans '' would ensure the site 's safety .

text: a group of sixth-form students from woodley , led by their maths teacher have made the final of the choir : gareth 's best in britain .
the bulmershe ensemble will feature in the bbc 2 show tonight at 21.00 gmt .

documents.title: fa cup : reading get 'plum draw '
text: reading have landed a plum draw in the third round of the fa cup .
they 'll travel to old trafford to play manchester united on the weekend of january 7 2017 .
the headline writers will be focusing on the jaap stam factor .
he made his name as a player at old trafford before falling out with sir alex ferguson in 2001 .
this will be his first visit to old trafford as a manager .
the photographers will be hoping for a snap of stam and ferguson shaking hands .
there 's history between jose mourinho , the current manchester united manager , and reading , as well .
mourinho was in charge of chelsea when petr cech and stephen hunt collided at the madejski stadium .
he later blasted the reading ambulance service for not acting fast enough .
mission impossible for reading ?
not necessarily .
reading last played manchester united in the fa cup in februray 2007 .
a brynjar gunnarsson equaliser was enough to take it to a replay .
reading went 3-0 down early at the madejski stadium , but nearly got back into it .
that game finished 3-2 .
author: Tim Dellor
BBC Berkshire sport editor

documents.title: # dryswimchallenge to protest arthur hill closure
text: people campaigning to keep arthur hill swimming pool in reading open have been posting of themselves swimming on dry land on twitter .
campaigners have also crowdfunded £ 6,000 of their £ 10,000 target to set up a community interest group to keep the pool open .
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid can you share our # dryswimchallenge ?

documents.title: misty and foggy this morning
text: good morning !
a misty and foggy start , but a bit warmer in berkshire this morning .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , weather , travel and sport on our local live service .
keep in touch with us on our facebook and twitter pages .
